activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10104
ohcnetwork/care_fe#10108
activity.text:
@rithviknishad 



Person A 

1.Logs into the website normally with their username and password
2.Opens the browser's developer tools (F12)
3.Types this in the console:

4.const x = localStorage.getItem('care_access_token');
5.console.log('stolen token is: ', x);

Gets a long string of characters starting with 'eyJhbG...'
Sends this string to Person B

Person B 
1.Opens the same website (but doesn't log (in other browsers or other computer) 
2.Opens developer tools (F12)
3.Pastes this in the console:

localStorage.setItem('care_access_token', 'eyJhbG...'); // Pastes Person A's token
window.location.reload();

 Gets access to Person A's account!

Think of it like finding someone's house key and making a copy - Person B now has full access to Person A's account without ever knowing the password. This is why storing tokens in localStorage is dangerous.

For example:

 Imagine an admin who manages logins for all workers in an organization
Worker A gets logged in by the admin,
Worker A steals token and shares it with others.
so, once worker A is logged in, others can access the website even without knowing credentials by sharing the token.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10108
activity.text: Authentication Bypass Through LocalStorage Token Exploitation

activity.text:
@rithviknishad 
When we switch from "Name" to "Encounter ID".
Name tab: "ABC" → switch to Encounter ID → switch back → **still shows "ABC"**   (Remain)
or
Name tab: "ABC" → switch to Encounter ID → switch back → **empty/blank**  (Disappear)
Do we need to disappear the typed text in "Name" . Is this correct ?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#9867
activity.text:

Just for clarification, in the screenshot, 'er' details should be shown when we switch and come back to the same tab, and 'er' in the search bar should also be cleared.
